input: Anne is big. Anne is blue. Anne is furry. Anne is quiet. Anne is red. Anne is round. Anne is white. Bob is big. Bob is blue. Bob is furry. Bob is red. Bob is round. Dave is quiet. Dave is round. Gary is blue. Gary is quiet. Red things are blue. If something is furry and red then it is big. If Dave is blue then Dave is white. If something is furry and red then it is quiet. All quiet things are blue. All white things are furry. If something is red then it is big. All furry, white things are red. Question: Dave is not big.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Big Anne
axiom T2 : Blue Anne
axiom T3 : Furry Anne
axiom T4 : Quiet Anne
axiom T5 : Red Anne
axiom T6 : Round Anne
axiom T7 : White Anne
axiom T8 : Big Bob
axiom T9 : Blue Bob
axiom T10 : Furry Bob
axiom T11 : Red Bob
axiom T12 : Round Bob
axiom T13 : Quiet Dave
axiom T14 : Round Dave
axiom T15 : Blue Gary
axiom T16 : Quiet Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Blue x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Red x → Big x
axiom R3 : Blue Dave → White Dave
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Red x → Quiet x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Quiet x → Blue x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Furry x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Big x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ White x → Red x

theorem dave_is_not_big : ¬ Big Dave :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Dave is big

theorem dave_is_big : Big Dave :=
begin
  apply R7,
  apply R8,
  split,
  apply R6,
  apply R3,
  apply R5,
  exact T13,
  exact T13,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
